author: Unreal Engine
description: We should be fully set up on... Dec 11 at 2PM ET! So, join us and some very special friends live right here on the Unreal Engine YouTube channel, as we take a look back at this year and look forward to another!
title: The End of Year stream set is really coming together 👀

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm presents an accessible grooming system in Houdini designed to simplify the creation of MetaHuman hairstyles.

The presentation covers a streamlined, artist-friendly workflow that reduces complexity through parametric controls and region-based styling, enabling efficient hair generation without requiring deep technical knowledge.

Watch to explore a simplified import and export pipeline that ensures fast iteration and full compatibility with custom MetaHuman heads in Unreal Engine.

Learn more about the MetaHuman framework here: metahuman.com

#Grooms, #Houdini, #MetaHuman, #DigitalHumans, #MetaHumanCreator, #UnrealEngine, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Crafting Parametric Hairstyles for MetaHumans | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
As tech artists, we love to analyze the performance of our game, and we want to be able to automate the process of gathering that data, right? 

Automation leads to consistency, and consistency can be used to measure the impact of specific changes or catch regressions. 

There’s a few different ways that tech artists can lead the charge in automating this process, and in this talk recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, we’ll discuss options for automating performance testing from quick and easy to robust, configurable, and extensible.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#TechArt, #AutomatedPerformanceTesting, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: A Tech Artist's Guide to Automated Performance Testing | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

description:
Watch this video for an introduction to the new Unreal Engine Animation Hub video series.

Animation Hub is your space for mastering advanced techniques in Unreal Engine. Explore short, focused tutorials that cover everything from rigging and animation to rendering, simulation, and beyond.

Whether you're refining your craft or breaking new ground, you'll find the tools and insights you need to take your skills to a professional level in this series.

Don’t miss the next episodes in our Animation Hub series—designed to get you up to speed with animation in Unreal Engine, fast.

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This talk recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm introduces a new spectral rendering pipeline within Unreal Engine, overcoming the limitations of traditional RGB rendering by replicating true-to-life light-material interactions, leading to a reduction in costly prototyping mistakes.

Accurate, physics-based information is essential to validate aesthetic and functional appearance, identifying potential design flaws before expensive physical prototypes are created. 

Beyond design and engineering, this advanced rendering technology promises substantial benefits in VFX, gaming, AI training, and more, thanks to its seamless integration and minimal setup time.

This talk explains the importance of spectral and measurement-based rendering, especially when preparing to prototype industrial products. The talk also covers iso-photography—what it is, and how you can perform it using the UVR Predict Engine industrial plugin for Unreal Engine.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#P
title: Industrial Prototyping with Spectral Rendering in Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
